message: hello guys. I also decided to use google-oauth backend and have registered my app with google. I got the GOOGLE_CONSUMER_KEY and GOOGLE_CONSUMER_SECRET from google and inspite I have it set up, the google still displays the yellow warning that the app is unverified and uses GOOGLE_DISPLAY_NAME (if I unset it it displays Social Auth). Any idea?

Yep I feel like google thinks my app is unregistered because it displays the warning in yellow. It says " The application that directed you here claims to be "Social Auth". We are unable to verify this claim as the application runs on your computer, as opposed to a website. We recommend you deny access unless you trust the application." even though I have both consumer key and secret set up
I can't figure out why google thinks my app is unregistered - any ideas?

@omab I've been discussing this issue with mlavin today, and the problem resides  in that the dsa always sets xoauth_displayname, while it shouldn't for registered apps. Please see an existing issue covering this problem at https://github.com/omab/django-social-auth/issues/156
